utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God! I can’t believe my little brother is married!

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: Oh I know!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You guys, why didn’t you tell me you were eloping?

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: ‘Cause it just sorta happened, y’know we were at the courthouse, we were having lunch…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait, wait, why were you at the courthouse?

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: We were having lunch. Yeah and then all of the sudden we were like, "Hey! Y'know, we’re here, having lunch let’s get married!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow, a year and a half ago I didn’t even know I had a brother, and now I have a sister too. Okay. Okay. Stop it, don’t. So, I gotta get you a gift now. Is there anything you need?

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: Uhh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: We’ve been trying to get pregnant, uh pretty much ever since we got engaged, we thought we’d get a jump on things, y’know no one’s getting any younger.

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: See the thing is umm, we’re not able to y’know, uh, conceive.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: And we’ve tried everything, we’ve seen a bunch of doctors.

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: Yeah, and they-and they say that our-that our only chance to have a baby is that if they take my sperm, her egg and put it together in a dish and then put it into another girl. So we were wondering if you could be the girl that we could put it into.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s a really nice gift. I was thinking of like a gravy boat.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! You guys! Check it out, check it out! Guess which job I got.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t know, but Donald Trump wants his blue blazer black.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Blue blazer back. He-he wants it back.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But you-you said black. Why would he want his blue blazer black?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, you-you know what I meant.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, you messed it up. You’re stupid.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So what job did you get Joe?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, ah, tour guide at the museum. Yeah, Ross got it for me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, how can you be a tour guide, don’t you have to be a dinosaur expert or something?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, not really. They give you all the information, it’s uh, it’s like memorizing a script. "And on your left, you have Tyrannosaurus Rex, a carnivore from the Jurassic period.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh actually Joey, it’s the Cretasous period.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah but, I can pronounce Jurassic.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Guess what. Frank Jr., and Alice got married!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh my God!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: And! And, they’re gonna have a baby! And! And, they want me to grow it for them in my uterus.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: My God!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are you serious?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You’re really thinking about having sex with your brother?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ewww! And "Oh no!" It’s—they just want me to be the surrogate. It’s her-it’s her egg and her sperm, and I’m-I’m just the oven, it’s totally their bun.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What did you tell them?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, they said that I had to think about it first, but what is there to think about? I’m gonna be giving them the greatest gift you can possibly give.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You’re gonna be carrying their baby and give them a Sony Play Station?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Honey, this really is an incredible thing to do for them, but there are things to think about.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, like you’re gonna be pregnant. I mean pregnant.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Pheebs, you’re talking about putting your body through an awful lot, I mean morning sickness, uhh, labour, and it’s all for somebody else!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, what’s your point?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, the stuff I just mentioned.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! I don’t know if I could ever do that. I always figured the first time I had a baby was with somebody I love and that baby would be a…keeper.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Y'know you guys were a lot more supportive when I wanted to make denim furniture.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, Pheebs, listen, if you decide to do this, we’ll be supportive like crazy.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We just want you to think it through.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, honey, maybe you can talk to somebody who’s had a baby. Like your mom?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: My mom never gave birth. Oh! But my birth mom did.

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Umm, I love this touchy. Can I take it to work with me?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, sure, it’s not mine anyway. It can with the pants.

utterance.speaker: Kathy
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I am so jealous.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You guys are really right…there aren’t you?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes. Right where?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: In the beginning where y’know it’s all sex and talking and sex and talking and…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, you-you gotta love the talking.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And the sex?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, we haven’t had sex yet. Okay, what’s the big deal? Y’know? This is special, and I want our love to grow until we move on to the next level.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, Chandler that is so nice.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That is really nice…lying! No way is that the reason!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why? Just because you’re not mature enough to understand something like that?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, he’s right, I’m totally lying.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Then what is it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, Kathy’s last boyfriend was Joey.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And you’re afraid you won’t be able to…fill his shoes.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, I’m afraid I won’t be able to make love as well as him.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, I was going for the metaphor.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, and I was saying the actual words.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So big deal, so Joey’s had a lot of girlfriends, it doesn’t mean he’s great in bed.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We share a wall! So either he’s great in bed, or she just likes to agree with him a lot.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Sweetie, with you it’s gonna be different. The sex is gonna be great, ‘cause you-you guys are in love.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Just go for it Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, you should.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, you should, really.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Go on.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, all right, I’ll go sleep with my girlfriend. But I’m just doing it for you guys.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, now the Mastodon is from the semi-late Jurassic period.

utterance.speaker: Smart Kid
utterance.content: Isn’t the Mastodon from the Pliocene Epic?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Shhh! This is a museum, no talking. Right down here, we have a large foot. Uhh, and over here we have Ross Geller. Everyone wave ‘Hi’ to Ross. Ross is one of our most important scientists, look at him, hard at work. Okay, moving right along. Come on.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr
utterance.content: It’s open! Come in!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I’m late.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr
utterance.content: Oh, that’s okay, it gave me time to finish glazing my nipples.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! You really go all out when you’re expecting company.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr
utterance.content: No, I was working on my pottery.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! Ooh! Oh, I didn’t know that you did…pot.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr
utterance.content: Well, yeah, mostly nudes. It combines my two passions, pottery and erotica.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, erotiery!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr
utterance.content: Hey! Okay! Well thanks for coming out to see me. I just-I just thought it would be a very good idea to talk about this baby stuff in person. Y’know…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr
utterance.content: I really don’t think it’s a very good idea, Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr
utterance.content: Well, because you’d be giving up a baby, and I-I really don’t—I don’t know if there’s anything I can say that could make you understand the pain of giving up a baby. So, umm,

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no! No-no! I understand the pain! Don’t-don’t hurt the puppy.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr
utterance.content: No-no-no, the-the puppy’s yours.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I get a puppy!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr
utterance.content: Well, yeah! I mean yeah, but only for three days.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr
utterance.content: I realise I don’t have any right to start get all parenty on you and everything now, but umm, uhh… Phoebe, would you please look at me and not the puppy, it’s very important.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr
utterance.content: I mean, I know what I’m talking about. I gave up two babies, and I only wish I had someone there that had given up babies, that could tell me how terrible it is to give up babies. I just think that, it would be something you will regret every single day for the rest of your life. So, how ever hard it is to give up this puppy, it would be like a million times harder to give up a child. I really shouldn’t have given you the puppy first.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uhh, do you mind sitting there. I’m-I’m saving this for my friend Ross.

utterance.speaker: Tour Guide
utterance.content: You mean Dr. Geller?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Doctor? Wow! I didn’t know he had a nickname.

utterance.speaker: Tour Guide
utterance.content: Oh, he won’t sit here. Only the people in the white coats sit over there, and only the people in the blue blazers sit here.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, how-how come?

utterance.speaker: Tour Guide
utterance.content: That’s just the way it is.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s crazy.

utterance.speaker: Tour Guide
utterance.content: Maybe it’s crazy in a perfect world, a world without lab coats and blazers, but you not in a perfect world, you in a museum now. See that scientist in the classes, he and I used to play together all the time in grade school, but now… Peter! Hey, Peter! It’s me Rhonda! From PS-129! I shared my puddin’ which you man! I gave you my Snack Pack! See, he pretend he don’t even here me!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I-I think everybody’s pretending they don’t hear you. Anyway, look, I don’t know about you and your jackets and your separate tables, but Ross is one of my best friends, and if I save him a seat, I’m telling you, he will sit in it! Ross! Ross! Over here, man! I-I saved you seat.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s okay, I’m cool over here. I’ll catch up with you later, Joey.

utterance.speaker: Tour Guide
utterance.content: Op, this is saved. Gift shop.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, uh, I’m really, really sorry about what happened in the cafeteria today.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It’s no big deal. Hey, y’know, you do what you gotta do. Right?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: But hey, it’s not just me, I mean the scientists and the tour guides never sit together.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Whatever.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s like that everywhere, Joey! Okay, Mon, back me up here. Where you work the uh, waiters eat with the waiters, right? And the chefs eat with the other chefs, right?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I eat by myself in the alley because everybody hates me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look, Ross, really it’s-it’s no big deal. Y’know you wear a white coat, I wear a blue blazer, if that means we can’t be friends at work, then so be it. Y’know, hey I understand. Y’know? Hey, when I’m in a play and you’re in the audience, I don’t talk to you, right? So it’s y’know, it’s uh, it’s cool. I’ll see you tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, when we’re in the audience he doesn’t talk to us, but he does wave.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why is Phoebe singing to Carl Mulden?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, y’know what, I think it’s time for puppy to go out again. Come on, let’s go to the balcony.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, the street. Come on, let’s go to the street. Ooh, listen, don’t go onto the balcony until after I get back.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So, did you do it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, yes, we had the sex.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Uh-oh, it was bad?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It was fine, y’know? But she didn’t agree with me as strongly as she agreed with Joey. She was more like, "I see you point, I’m all right with it."

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, it was the first time. Y’know, there’s not always a lot of agreement the first time.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, not girls anyway, guys agree like that.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, you have to help me! Okay? I mean, I know what to do with a woman, y’know, I know where everything goes, it’s always nice. But I need to know what makes it go from nice to, "My God! Somebody’s killing her in there!"

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, I’m gonna show you something a lot of guys don’t know. Rach, give me that pad, please? All right. Now…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, you don’t have to draw an actual wo—whoa! She’s hot!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Now everybody knows the basic erogenous zones. You got one, two three, four , five, six, and seven!

utterance.content: There are seven?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Let me see that. Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s one?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s kind of an important one!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, y’know-y’know what, I was looking at it upside down.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, y’know, sometimes that helps.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Now, most guys will hit uh, 1-2-3 and then go to 7 and set up camp.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That-that’s bad?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well if you go to Disneyland, you don’t spend the whole day on the Materhorn.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well you might if it were anything like 7!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right uh, the important thing is to take your time, you want to hit ‘em all, and you mix ‘em up. You gotta keep them on their toes.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oo, toes!! Well, for some people.

utterance.speaker: Older Scientist
utterance.content: Dr. Geller, there’s a seat over here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thank you, Dr. Phillips, but I’m having my lunch at this table, here in the middle. I’m having lunch right here, with my good friend Joey, if he’ll sit with me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I will sit with you Dr. Geller.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y'know, we work in a museum of natural history, and yet there is something unnatural about the way we eat lunch. Now, I look around this cafeteria, and y’know what I see, I see-I see division. Division, between people in white coats and people in blue blazers, and I ask myself, "My God why?!" Now, I say we shed these-these coats that separate us, and we get to know the people underneath. I’m Ross! I’m divorced, and I have a kid!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m Joey! I’m an actor! I don’t know squat about dinosaurs!

utterance.speaker: Another Tour Guide
utterance.content: I’m Ted, and I just moved here a month ago, and New York really scares me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right, there you go!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, you hang in there Teddy!

utterance.speaker: Older Scientist
utterance.content: I’m Andrew, and I didn’t pay for this pear.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, good-good for you.

utterance.speaker: Tour Guide
utterance.content: I’m Rhonda, and these aren’t real!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wow, Rhonda.

utterance.speaker: Another Scientist
utterance.content: I’m Scott.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, okay, Scott!

utterance.speaker: Another Scientist
utterance.content: And I need to flip the light switch on and off 17 times before I leave a room or my family will die.

utterance.content: My mom’s gonna be here any minute. I can’t do this, I can’t give him up. Yes—no, I can. I don’t want to. But I can. No.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oo, I can’t watch this, it’s like Sophie’s Choice.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y’know, I never saw that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh, it was only okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, I can’t do this. My mom was right. If I can’t-if I can’t give him up, then there’s no way I can give up a baby. Ohh, God, Frank and Alice are gonna be so crushed. What-what else, what else can I give ‘em—a kidney!

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Uhh, we were just in the neighbourhood, so…

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: Yeah, so we just thought we’d stop by and let you know there’s still no pressure.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: None. But if there was something you wanted to tell us, we’re just gonna be right over there having coffee.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: Oh, who’s this little guy?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! Ooh! Umm!

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: Oh, he’s so cute, he reminds me of my old dog, Tumour.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: You are so precious, I could just take you home.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, why don’t you?

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: Are you serious?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh, yeah!

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: Oh, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, I’m really okay with this. Y’know why? ‘Cause look at them, and I made that, so… I know it’s gonna be like a million times harder to give up a baby but, oh my God, it’s gonna feel like a million times better, right? I wanna do this. I wanna carry your baby.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Oh! Oh! Oh! Thank you so much! You don’t know what this means to us! Oh!

utterance.speaker: Frank
utterance.content: Oh my God, I think I’m gonna cry!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s gonna be so great.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr
utterance.content: Hi! What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I-I gave them the puppy and it made them so happy that I decided I’m gonna carry their baby.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr
utterance.content: But Phoebe…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No-no-no, I know, but you and I are different people though, and this is a totally different situation, and I know that I am not gonna regret this.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe Sr
utterance.content: Oh, I-I-I understand all that, but it’s just—that was my puppy.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.content: Would you ever be a surrogate for anyone?
